Freeciv 3.0.91-dev governments help (MP2 Dragoon)

Anarchy

Anarchy is simply the absence of any recognizable government. Citizens are disorganized and unproductive, and will spend all income as quickly as possible, rather than paying taxes or conducting research. Unless a city has a Courthouse or is celebrating, worked tiles suffer an output penalty of  -1 if they produce 3 or more of any resource.

Anarchy pays no upkeep for buildings.

City Happiness vs. Empire Size

        0-9

Free Unit Upkeep 3 0 free upkeep of [a] shields and [b] gold 


Corruption 25% 2% base [a]% corruption plus [b]% for each tile distant from a capital 


Martial Law ♾️ 1 max. [a] units, which appease [b] each 


Civil War  90% chance if capital lost 


Maximum Tax Rate  0% all trade goes to luxury 


Tile Penalty 1 3 tile penalty of [a] for outputs of [b] or more, unless celebrating 


Content Cities 9 6 first [a] cities no penalty; extra +1 discontent after each extra [b] cities 


Razed Buildings 21% 10% in conquest of [a] foreign city, [b] liberating own city 


Homeless Unit Disbanding 100% 75% if not in city, disband-odds if home city lost: [a] normal [b] nuclear units 


Military Unhappiness   first [a] units cause no discontent; afterward, each causes [b] discontent 



• Cities may celebrate at size 3.
• Each worked tile has no output penalty while its city is celebrating.
• Celebrating cities cannot rapture.
• Anarchy pays no upkeep for buildings.

Despotism

Under Despotism, you are the absolute ruler of your people. Your control over your citizens is maintained largely by martial law. Under Despotism, tiles suffer a -1 tile output penalty if they produce 3 resource points. Despotism suffers the highest level of corruption of all forms of government.

On the plus side, there is no limit to martial law units. The capital gets a +75% production bonus. Each city gets 3 shields of free unit upkeep. There is no limit to martial law units.

Civil War  80% chance if capital lost 


Maximum Tax Rate  60% for gold/luxury/science

Homeless Unit Disbanding 75% 50% if not in city, disband-odds if home city lost: [a] normal [b] nuclear units 


Military Unhappiness   first [a] units cause no discontent; afterward, each causes [b] discontent 



• Cities may celebrate at size 3.
• Each worked tile has no output penalty while its city is celebrating.
• Celebrating cities cannot rapture.
• Newly founded cities get +2 food (+4 for capital.)
• Gulag：You can starve cities without lawlessness with a martial count of 2; needing +2 more at 20 population and +2 more for each 10 population thereafter.
• Authoritarian: Police Stations force an additional 2 citizens to be content.

Monarchy

Under Monarchy, a king or queen serves as a hereditary figurehead for your government.

Monarchy suffers the same small amount of corruption that the Republic does. Each city gets 3 shields and 1 gold of free unit upkeep. The capital gets a 50% production bonus.

Requires knowledge of the technology Monarchy.

• Each worked tile with trade will yield +1 more trade while its city is celebrating.



  Constitutional Monarchy

Constitutional Monarchy is somewhat between Monarchy and representative government.

Celebrating cities founded by you can rapture 4 out of 5 turns.
Celebrating cities not founded by you rapture 1 out of 4 turns.
Celebrating cities not founded by you can rapture 3 out of 5 turns, if they have no foreign citizens.

Requires knowledge of the technology Monarchy and the Magna Carta Wonder.

Capital bonus 50%  production [a]%   gold [b]% 


Free Unit Upkeep 1 1 free upkeep of [a] shields and [b] gold

• +1 trade on each land tile that produces trade.
• Cities may celebrate at size 3.
• When celebrating, +1 trade on every ocean tile.
• Celebrating cities can grow by rapture.
• Allows you to build Peasants in the city with Magna Carta.
• Gives +1 build slot in the city with Magna Carta.
• Has a senate that may prevent declaration of war.
• May ignore senate if you have the Statue of Liberty; OR both King Richard’s Crusade and J.S. Bach’s Cathedral.

Republic

Under the Republic government, citizens hold an election to select a representative who will govern them; since elected leaders must remain popular to remain in control, citizens are given a greater degree of freedom.  Citizens under the Republic become unhappy easily, but the self-sufficiency of your citizens allows high levels of trade.

Celebrating cities can rapture 9 out of 10 turns.
Celebrating cities not founded by you can rapture 1 out of 3 turns.
Celebrating cities not founded by you can rapture 4 out of 5 turns, if they have no foreign citizens.

Requires knowledge of the technology The Republic.

• Celebrating cities may grow by rapture.
• Has a senate that may prevent declaration of war.
• May ignore senate if you have the Statue of Liberty.

Democracy

Under Democracy, citizens govern directly by voting on issues. Democracy offers the highest level of trade. Base corruption is half that of Republic or Monarchy, and corruption from distance to a capital is very low. Citizens become very upset during wars. Democracy revolts to Anarchy if any city remains lawless for two turns. Cities and units belonging to Democracy have triple the cost to incite or bribe, respectively.

All celebrating cities with no foreign citizens can rapture every turn.
See table below for other rapture rates.

Requires knowledge of the technology Democracy.

• You pay 2 times normal Food upkeep for your units.
• Cities may celebrate at size 3.
• Celebrating cities may grow by rapture.
• If a city is lawless for more than 2 turns in a row, government will fall into Anarchy.
• Has a senate that may prevent declaration of war.
• May ignore senate if you have the Statue of Liberty.

Theocracy

Theocracy is formed on religious beliefs which are the law of the land.

The people are devoted and often willing to die for their faith. Cities very near a capital have very low corruption. Cost for enemies to incite cities or bribe units is 2x, but Zealots and Fanatics cannot be bribed. Cost to incite foreign cities is reduced by a third. Enemies cannot establish embassies without first making Ceasefire or Peace.

Improvements that appease unhappy citizens add +1 gold in tithes for each citizen appeased. Science output suffers -30%. Palace gives +50% to gold income in its city. In cities, two military units may impose martial law, affecting one citizen each. Pilgrims can be made to migrate and grow cities.

Celebrating cities can rapture 2 out of 5 turns.
Celebrating cities can rapture 4 out of 7 turns if they have a Cathedral building present in the city.

Requires knowledge of the technology Theocracy.

• Cities may celebrate at size 3.
• When celebrating, +1 trade on each worked tile that produces trade.
• Celebrating cities can grow by rapture.
• You pay 2 times normal Food upkeep for your units.
• Science production is decreased 30%.
• Buildings and Wonders that make citizens content give +1 gold per citizen affected.
• Bribe cost for units is 2×.
• Can incite foreign cities for 1/3 the cost.
• Enemies can't establish embassies without first making Cease-fire or Peace.
• Pays no upkeep for Pilgrims, Patriarch, Zealots, or Fanatics.
• Allows Pilgrims, Falconeers, Patriarch, Zealots, Fanatics.

Communism

Communism puts all output under state control. Each city gets 4 shields and 3 gold of free unit upkeep. Buildings with 1 upkeep are free. Irrigated tiles receive +1 trade.

The capital gets +40% production. Each city gets the effects of a Supermarket for free. Celebrating cities with Granary get +1 food output, if not on Mountains. These bonuses stack with all other food bonuses. The effect of Cathedrals and Michelangelo's Chapel is reduced -1.

Riflemen, Ground Troops, Light Armor, Armor, Armor II, and Dive Bombers cost less. New diplomatic units are v1.

Communists can use Proletarians to re-distribute population, or as workers. Communism tech allows Communists to convert Workers to Riflemen and vice versa, in domestic territory.

Your nation is completely unaffected by empire size and number of cities.
Celebrating cities can rapture 2 out of 5 turns.

City Happiness vs. Empire Size


        
Cities:
        0-∞
        -
        -
        -
        -

Communism traits [a] [b] notes


Capital bonus 40%  production [a]%   gold [b]% 


Free Unit Upkeep 4 3 free upkeep of [a] shields and [b] gold 


Corruption 20% 0% base [a]% corruption plus [b]% for each tile distant from a capital 


Martial Law 3 2 max. [a] units, which appease [b] each 


Civil War  50% chance if capital lost 


Maximum Tax Rate  80% for gold/luxury/science 


Tile Penalty   tile penalty of [a] for outputs of [b] or more, unless celebrating 


Content Cities 14 15 first [a] cities no penalty; extra +1 discontent after each extra [b] cities 


Razed Buildings 21% 10% in conquest of [a] foreign city, [b] liberating own city 


Homeless Unit Disbanding 45% 20% if not in city, disband-odds if home city lost: [a] normal [b] nuclear units 


Military Unhappiness   first [a] units cause no discontent; afterward, each causes [b] discontent 



• +1 trade on each irrigated tile that produces trade.
• Cities may celebrate at size 3.
• Celebrating cities can grow by rapture.
• When celebrating, +1 trade on each trade tile not already getting a trade bonus.
• When celebrating, +1 food on city center tile if it has a Granary and the city is not on Mountains.
• Each city has the effect of a Supermarket for free.
• Can convert Workers and Workers II to Riflemen and vice versa, in domestic territory.
• New Emissary, Diplomat, and Spy units will be veteran.
• Cathedral and Michelangelo effects diminished by -1.
• Disqualified from all bonuses to Coinage.
• Riflemen, Ground Troops, and Light Armor cost 5 less
• Armor, Armor II, and Dive Bombers cost 10 less.
• Allows Proletarians.
• Gulag：You can starve cities without lawlessness with a martial count of 3; needing +2 more at 20 population and +2 more for each 10 population thereafter.
• Authoritarian: Police Stations force an additional 2 citizens to be content.

Nationalism

Nationalism glorifies national supremacy over other peoples. Citizens and corporatations align under a dictator who rules over a unified populace, military, and isolationist economy.

Content cities get a +1 trade bonus on Land tiles only. Celebrating cities also get Ocean tiles. Cities may rapture at a 100% rate if founded under the original national hegemony. Luxury suffers a 15% penalty. Government mandated Science gets +20% in original cities.

Each city gets 1 shield of free unit upkeep. The city with a Palace gets +15% production. Original cities have a 3x incite cost, otherwise cost one third.

Police Stations cost 10 shields less. Five military units may impose martial law, affecting one citizen each. Migrants can be made to help grow cities. Tile workers gain a ⅑ move bonus; and for every three worker turns of work put in, get a fourth worker turn free. Cost of upgrades is 25% less. Riflemen are produced at +1 vet level. Armor types get a +1 move bonus. Fighters and Dive Bombers have 50% higher odds of promotion.

Requires knowledge of the technology Nationalism.

• +1 trade on each land tile that produces trade.
• Cities may celebrate at size 3.
• Celebrating cities can grow by rapture.
• When celebrating, ocean tiles get +1 trade.
• You pay 2 times normal Food upkeep for your units.
• New Riflemen units will have the rank of veteran.
• Armor units gain +1 move.
• Fighter and Dive Bomber units are promoted 50% more frequently.
• Police Stations cost 10 less.
• Science production is increased 20% in original cities.
• Luxury production is decreased 15%.
• Cities founded by you have double the cost to incite them.
• Cities not founded by you cost 1/3 to incite.
• Allows Migrants.
• Tile workers gain a ⅑ move bonus
• For every three worker-turns, tile workers get a fourth worker-turn free (1.34x worker-turn bonus).
